data.title: Soap star 'theatened Jim' : News 2004 : Chortle : The UK Comedy Guide
data.meta_description: Soap star 'theatened Jim' - Davidson in trouble over dirty joke
data.text:
EastEnders actor Steve McFadden has reportedly threatened Jim Davidson over a dirty joke he made about his girlfriend.

The 50-year-old comic called police over the alleged threat, which came in a phone call.

Davidson cracked his off-colour gag during a gig in Southampton that he had organised for the widow of murdered policeman Ian Broadhurst, killed in Leeds last month.

The comedian is currently appearing with McFadden's partner Lucy Benjamin in the panto Aladdin, and she was in Monday night's audience when he cracked the joke.

The pair later went to dinner, which is when 33-year-old Benjamin, who plays Lisa Fowler in EastEnders, called her boyfriend about the gag.

Davidson then came on the line to explain, which is when 44-year-old McFadden allegedly made the threats, Ananova reports.

The comic called police, who took statements, but he decided not to take the matter any further.

A Hampshire Police spokeswoman said: "We can confirm that a complaint was received regarding a threat made against a 50-year-old man.

"A statement was taken from him but he didn't wish to proceed any further with the complaint and no further action is being taken."

Published: 29 Jan 2004
